overview: Films include: * Music Studio: Harry Partch (1958): Partch takes the viewer on a tour of his Chicago home, and plays his microtonal instruments. Includes his demonstration of how the soundtrack for Windsong was made. * Windsong (1958): the ancient Greek legend of Daphne and Apollo, transported to Lake Michigan. * U.S. Highball (1958; completed 1968): Partch and his ensemble perform a dramatized account of riding the rails during the Depression on a transcontinental hobo trip from California to Chicago. * Rotate the Body in All Its Planes (1961): Harry's favorite: a ballet for gymnasts.  The DVD is accompanied by a 12-page booklet featuring writings by Philip Blackburn, Danlee Mitchell, and Harry Partch.
title: Harry Partch: Enclosure 8
